page.title: 03TAKELEY, THE VILLAGE
page.content: Takeley is a long village stretched out along the A120 road. Originally the whole village lay on the north side of the road but since the 1930's a little development has taken place to the south; the railway has created a barrier to further development. The village, unlike many nearby, is not noted for its beauty but does have several buildings of great historical interest. Today the village has only 5 shops and 3 public houses which compares with 10 public houses and 15 shops in 1821. Great changes have taken place over the past twenty years with many newcomers arriving. To its great credit, the village has accepted them all and they have been fully absorbed into the community. This is reflected in the large number of active clubs and societies which flourish in the village today.
